__e: Inevereventoldmymother, mybestfriend,thatIwas gay becauseI wasafraid shewouldn'tacceptme. That'swhy we'reonthisjourney:
I don't know, I guess I was worried you wouldn't... like the real me.
Because I was afraid you wouldn't even sit down for coffee if you knew why your brother was here.
I was afraid that if I told you the truth, you'd become scared of me.
I was afraid if I asked to come, you'd say no.
If I say something... if I said that I knew... I'm afraid that he'll leave.
If I say something... if I said that I knew... I'm afraid that he'll leave.
That might have been the right thing to do, but I was worried that you might say "no," and there really isn't much time to waste.
And if you found out she was my sister, I was afraid you were gonna start asking questions I wasn't ready to answer. And...
Oh, my God, I was worried that I didn't feed the cat, but then I rembered that I did.
And I know I should have told you this sooner, but I thought you were this incredible person who would have no interest in me.
And then, even if only briefly, to have failed to acknowledge it had been my wind, I'd...
I was getting really worried that I was overstaying my welcome.
This was the part of the Gala weekend that I was dreading the most.
And then, even if only briefly, to have failed to acknowledge it had been my wind, I'd...
I was afraid you'd say no.
I thought you'd abandoned me. I couldn't face life without you so I tried to end it all.
Uh, I didn't want to say anything. I thought you'd say not to.
I was afraid you might have... have harmed yourself.
I was worried you timed out.
And here I'd feared you'd left all this behind.
You know, I was afraid you wouldn't answer the door if you saw it was me, so I came up from the beach.
Been so long, I almost didn't think you were real.
A man who I shared this special little girl I had long ago foreseen, but feared I might never have.
